intro: Microchilus laticalcar, commonly known as the narrow-lobed rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to rocky and arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Microchilus laticalcar is often found growing on limestone outcrops and in dry, well-drained soils.
